tn.text: Ezekiel continues to tell about the vision God gave him. It started in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:01|8:1]].
"I heard him call out"
people who protect something.
weapon for destroying people or things
weapon for killing many people
The word "behold" here adds emphasis to what follows. It can also be translated as "indeed!"
a strong, smooth cloth made from a plant. It is worn by many people in places that are hot. Alternate translation: "smooth cloth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
tools that scribes use to write with
A dark gold-colored metal. It is made from mostly copper with tin added for strength. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: from the cherubim where it had been
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "from above the four winged creatures" ([[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:04|1:5]]) (UDB) or 2) from between the two cherubim in the most holy place in the temple. Try to translate this literally. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The "house" refers to God's temple.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:09:01|9:2]].
see how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:09:01|9:2]].
These are sounds people make when they feel very sad or grieved about something. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: the abominations being performed in the midst of the city
tn.text: "the horrible things being done in the city" or "the detestable things that people are doing in the city

tn.ref: he spoke to the others within my hearing
tn.text: The word "others" refers to the guards. (See: [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:09:01]])

tn.ref: Do not let your eyes have compassion
tn.text: "Do not have compassion on the people you see."
"do not refrain from killing"
These were the people who groaned about the abominations happening in Jerusalem. See how you translated "mark" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:09:03|9:4]].
"Begin to kill the ones who do not have the mark at my sanctuary" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Possible meanings are 1) the "seventy elders of the house of Israel" ([[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:10|8:11]]) or 2) any "old man" (verse 6).
God continuing to speak to the guards judging the people of Israel.
"attacked the people in the city"

"I bowed down to the ground" or "I lay on the ground." Ezekiel did not fall by accident. He went down to the ground to show that he respected and feared Yahweh. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:27|1:28]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Ezekiel says this because he is very troubled by what the Lord told the men to do to Jerusalem. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:04:14|4:14]].

tn.ref: will you destroy all the remnant of Israel in the outpouring of your wrath on Jerusalem?
tn.text: "will you destroy all the remnant of Israel by pouring out your wrath on Jerusalem?" Ezekiel is actually pleading with Yahweh not to destroy the remnant. AT: "please do not destroy all the remnant of Israel by pouring out your wrath on Jerusalem!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

The word "house" is a metonym for the family that lives in the house, in this case the Israelites, the descendants of Jacob over many years. AT: "the Israelite people group" Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"very great"

tn.ref: The land is full of blood
tn.text: "the land is full of violence" or "All over the land people are killing people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Possible meanings are 1) "the city is full of people who pervert justice" or 2) "the city is full of people who do perverse things." Alternate translations: "the city is full of people who act unjustly" (UDB) or "the city has many people who do wicked things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: my eye will not look with compassion
tn.text: "I will not look on them with compassion" or "I will not be compassionate to them." The eye here refers to how he regards people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: bring it all on their heads
tn.text: "bring the effects of what they have done on their heads." It means "I will repay them for what they have done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The word "behold" here adds emphasis to what follows. It can also be translated as "indeed!"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:09:01|9:2]].
"He reported to Yahweh and told him"
